channel.title: CVE Feed for Nagios -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Nagios -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-15709|2024-08-05T10:01:54.471Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows remote authenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted HTTP request.

item.title: CVE-2018-15708|2024-08-05T10:01:54.499Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Snoopy 1.0 in Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted HTTP request.

item.title: CVE-2018-15712|2024-08-05T10:01:54.594Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows reflected cross site scripting from remote unauthenticated attackers via the host parameter in api_tool.php.

item.title: CVE-2018-15714|2024-08-05T10:01:54.546Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows reflected cross site scripting from remote unauthenticated attackers via the oname and oname2 parameters.

item.title: CVE-2018-15713|2024-08-05T10:01:54.550Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows persistent cross site scripting from remote authenticated attackers via the stored email address in admin/users.php.

item.title: CVE-2018-15711|2024-08-05T10:01:54.534Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows remote authenticated attackers to reset and regenerate the API key of more privileged users. The attacker can then use the new API key to execute API calls at elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-15710|2024-08-05T10:01:54.535Z -- nagios -- nagios%20xi
item.description: Nagios XI 5.5.6 allows local authenticated attackers to escalate privileges to root via Autodiscover_new.php.
